channel.title: Certificates on Software Engineering & DevOps - Matt Britt
channel.description: Recent content in Certificates on Software Engineering & DevOps - Matt Britt

item.title: LFCS - Users and Groups
item.description: Continuing with LFCS prep, we are moving on to user and group management..

item.title: LFCS - Operations Deployment - Virtual Machines and Containers
item.description: Understanding VMs and containers, and how to manage them in Linux, is an important skill to master.

item.title: LFCS - Operations Deployment - Task Scheduling
item.description: Running periodic tasks can be very helpful with system maintenance, or application development tasks. Linux uses cron jobs for this.

item.title: LFCS - Operations Deployment - Log Files
item.description: Log files give you insight into your system and are very important for SRE and DevOps.

item.title: LFCS - Operations Deployment - Processes
item.description: Managing Linux processes is critical for DevOps and Linux administration!

item.title: LFCS - Essential Commands - File redirecton
item.description: File redirection is a core part of Linux, this post covers file stdin, stdout, stderr and other commands.

item.title: LFCS - Essential Commands - File content, bundling and compression
item.description: Continuing with the LFCS preparation series, this post covers various commands, including sed (stream editor), bundling and compression.

item.title: LFCS - Essential Commands - File searching
item.description: This post covers the commands for finding files on your system and searching the contents of files for patterns.

item.title: LFCS - Essential Commands - File management and permissions
item.description: A summary of the commands learnt in the essentials section of the LFCS course preparation.

item.title: Preparation for the LFCS exam
item.description: The Linux Foundation Certified System Administrator (LFCS) exam is a 2 hour performance based exam in which you solve multiple issues from the command line.
